page.title: 11FARMING IN IRCHESTER
page.content: There are three farms in and around Ir- chester.Though they carry livestock they are mainly arable farms. Mr Willmott owns Knuston Home Farm.He has owned the farm for 25 years; his parents owned it before him. There are 200 acres of land worth 2500 pounds each.In total there are 15 fields.The crops he grows are oil seed rape, potatoes and grass.He uses a nitrogen based fertiliser to replenish the soil each year. His livestock consists of 400 hens, producing eggs and meat;100 goslings, for Christmas dinners;8 sheep to keep the paddock tidy, of which 2 are killed and and put into the farmer's freezer, the rest are sold.In winter Mr Willmott rents out land where 70 cattle are grazed.The farmer owns 2 tractors and a combine harvester. Mr Willmott says he ejoys living on the farm.
